item.title: Noob Defense Best Units Tier List
item.description:
As befits the genre, your victory or defeat directly depends on your team in Noob Defense . Some can deal huge damage to single targets, while others boost the damage of the tower in the zone. You will be able to defend the most difficult stages only by combining their abilities. And to help you with this, we have ranked all the Noob Defense units in this Tier List.

Even though there are not many towers in this Roblox TD experience, each of them is unique. This applies not only to deployment costs but also to stats and abilities.

How to Get More Noob Defense Units

At first, you will only have access to one unit, and a rather weak one. But to get new ones, you will first have to earn Coins, which can be done by winning stages or using Noob Defense codes. Once you have collected enough money, you will only have to visit the summoning zone to get new units.

It is worth noting that banners change over time in this Roblox game, so you should not spend all the Coins at once, especially if you have already received every unit of the current banner. But after receiving dozens of new characters, the question arises which of them is the best. For this, we recommend that you take a look at the Noob Defense best units Tier List below.

Unit

Tier

Sakura Samurai Noob

S Tier

S Tier

Upgrade Engineer Noob

S Tier

Noob

King Noob

Slammer Noob

C Tier

Best Noob Defense Units

Among all the units in Noob Defense , there are several that are especially useful. You just need to place them on the field to be sure that no enemy will pass through them:

  • Sakura Samurai Noob - He is the best AoE DPS in this Roblox game and can solo most stages.
  • King of the Empire Noob - The unit has the largest range and is great for farming.
  • Upgrade Engineer Noob - The unit summons mobs to attack waves, so it can also solo most modes.

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 - 5 Best Attributes To Level Up, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Players gain EXP in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 to level up, with Skill Points and Attribute Points to enhance characters.
  • Attack Power, Critical Rate, and Defense are vital stats to boost in the game for offense, defense, and strategic gameplay.
  • Speed is key in winning battles, granting more turns, yet players should balance it with other stats for long-term success.

Players will level up in the traditional sense while playing Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 . Fighting enemies will net players EXP, which will then increase levels, but making the party stronger isn’t automatic. There are two types of points that players will get upon leveling up: Skill Points and Attribute Points.

Every character has a skill tree in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, and every character has an Attribute menu that can boost basic stats most RPG fans know about, like HP and Defense. There are five core Attributes in general, so which among them is the best to focus on leveling? While Attributes can be respeced, it's better to get them right the first time.

5 Attack Power

Raised Through Agility, Might, And Luck

Attack Power will boost the strength of all attacks, which is different from other RPGs that separate Strength and Wisdom/Intelligence between physical and magical attacks. In the game, players have three different types of attacks to use on enemies. There is the basic attack utilizing the character’s weapon in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , like Gustave’s sword.

Players can also select Free Aim, which uses a ranged attack to strike enemies at the cost of AP, and Gustave’s example in this case is a gun. AP is also used to execute special or magical attacks. Lune, for example, is like a classic RPG mage who can sling spells around. Raising Attack Power can strengthen all of these abilities, but raising the stat through the Might Attribute is sort of a waste as it won’t boost much compared to finding a good weapon or upgrading an existing one.

4 Critical Rate

Raised Through Defense And Luck

Critical Rate , like Attack Power, is a good offensive stat, and there are a couple of ways to increase it. It’s a better stat because a critical hit will always do 50% more damage, as stated in the game’s tutorial. The higher a character has their Critical Rate, the better chance they have to score a critical hit; simple as that.

Players can also find and equip accessories called Pictos in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 . Once a Picto’s ability is learned, any character can use it by equipping it in the Lumina menu. Many of these passive abilities can increase the strength or hit rate of a critical hit. Beyond Attack Power, players should know it’s best to think about their Critical Rate in this RPG, but it’s also a luck-based thing, as there is no way of predicting a critical hit. Players just have to cross their fingers and hope for the best during stressful situations.

3 Defense

Raised Through Agility And Defense

Defense is always a valuable stat in RPGs, especially for those who value defensive strategies over offensive ones. The higher a character’s Defense, the less damage they will take from an enemy’s head-on attacks. Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is different from most turn-based RPGs, though, as it has an active element to using Skills and getting attacked. First, when players use Skills, a Quick-Time Event will pop up, and the better players do, the more damage they will inflict.

On the defensive end, players can decide to Parry or Dodge an enemy’s attack. Both options will negate damage, but create different results. Dodge will grant players AP, while Parry will execute a counterattack, and this is the more attractive move. Both options are valuable, and they make a stat like Defense seemingly unnecessary. Still, players aren’t going to be able to Parry or Dodge every time, which is why raising Defense is a good safety net, especially while they're still learning the proper timing on a tough enemy's attacks.

2 Health

Raised Through Vitality

Health and Defense are closely intertwined in terms of their value in the game. Increasing Health will obviously raise a character’s HP. Even if their Defense is low, having more HP means players don’t have to heal as often or worry about dying as easily. Speaking of, there are very few ways to heal in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , so having a solid HP pool is highly recommended.

First, characters like Lune and Gustave can learn healing skills in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 . These can be used in battle as long as they have enough AP or meet other conditions. Players can also use potions, or Tints, in battle, which will recharge at checkpoints called Expedition Flags (think Bonfires in Dark Souls ). Players cannot stock up on potions like in other RPGs, which is why getting more HP through the Health Attribute is a good measure.

1 Speed

Raised Through Agility And Luck

Last, but not least, Speed is the quickest way to victory in the game. There aren’t that many time-based or active turn-based games out there, but there are a lot of turn-based games that choose to show turn order. One of the first to do it was Grandia on the Sega Saturn, although RPG fans are probably more familiar with Final Fantasy 10’s turn order system.

Legacies aside, with a greater Speed stat in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , players can have more turns in battle. If the party each gets an extra turn normally or occasionally in battle, then enemies will have less time to strike back, thus keeping everyone safer. It is simple math, although the further players get in the game, the harder it will be to keep up with the enemy's Speed stats. Players shouldn’t dump all Attribute Points into Speed, but it will certainly help in the long run.

10 Images
10 Images

item.title: The Outer Worlds 2 Feels Like Obsidian’s Answer to Starfield
item.description:
Summary

  • The Outer Worlds 2 is expanding its world to be twice as large as its predecessor.
  • It will feature over 90 unique perks for character customization, surpassing Starfield's 82 skills.
  • The game sets itself apart with self-aware humor that mocks industry norms and offers more deliberate gameplay.

Despite some of their most obvious differences, Starfield and The Outer Worlds have been frequently compared to one another, as they are both narrative-driven, first-person sci-fi RPGs developed by studios renowned for their storytelling — Bethesda and Obsidian Entertainment, respectively. In some ways, this makes the comparisons between the two justifiable. However, their clear differences — like Starfield 's larger scale, The Outer Worlds ' tightly woven narrative, and each title's unique approach to gameplay — are difficult to ignore. Nevertheless, it already seems like The Outer Worlds 2 might be Obsidian's answer to Starfield , whether the comparisons have been warranted or not.

Based on what has been revealed so far for The Outer Worlds 2 , Obsidian's long-awaited sequel looks to capitalize on the success of its predecessor by remaining faithful to its origins. At the same time, it appears to be making some major improvements to its gameplay, progression, and worldbuilding that could put the Starfield comparisons to rest by finding a happy medium between what the first Outer Worlds accomplished and the groundwork laid by Bethesda's sci-fi adventure.

The Outer Worlds 2 Is Rising Above Its Predecessor's Starfield Comparisons

The Outer Worlds 2 Is Larger Without Losing Itself

One of the main things that has separated Starfield from The Outer Worlds is its massive scale. Boasting over 1,000 planets for players to discover, Starfield makes it almost impossible for the average gamer to discover every inch of the game's explorable space, which has actually proven to be appealing to some. As grandiose as it sounds, though, this world design has led to a feeling of emptiness in Starfield , as traversing each planet eventually feels meaningless without purposeful content to reinforce their presence in the game.

It has been confirmed that there are actually around 1,700 planets and moons in Starfield , though only a small fraction of them are habitable.

That's actually where The Outer Worlds has always shined a bit brighter, with a world that is tighter and more dependent upon its lore and narrative than Starfield 's world is. That being said, The Outer Worlds is significantly smaller in scale than Starfield , allowing Bethesda's sci-fi epic to cast a looming shadow over one of Obsidian's greats. However, The Outer Worlds 2 is responding to that with a world that is twice as large as its predecessor's, which ultimately enables it to feel somewhat closer to what Starfield offers without losing its narrative-driven identity in the process.

The Outer Worlds 2 Is Adding New Skills to the Pot

Starfield 's scale didn't just come down to its exploration either, as its progression was even tied to that philosophy. At launch, Starfield had a whopping 82 skills for players to unlock, whereas The Outer Worlds only had 42. Now, The Outer Worlds 2 is deepening the role-playing mechanics of the first game by featuring over 90 unique perks for players to customize their character with. This will potentially put The Outer Worlds 2 ahead of Starfield in terms of playstyle customization, once again pointing to the sequel as an answer to the frequent comparisons drawn between its predecessor and Bethesda's sci-fi IP.

The Outer Worlds 2's Self-Aware Humor Sets It Apart

Finally, Starfield isn't without its own comedic moments, but they are a far cry from what The Outer Worlds , and now its successor, offer. The Outer Worlds 2 has already gone to great lengths during its marketing phase in showing one element that has always set it apart from its competitor: self-aware humor. The Outer Worlds 2 's self-aware humor not only functions as its trademark but also jabs at corporate structures in the gaming industry. As one of its trailers mockingly stated, "Everything that should have been in the first game: more action, more weapons, and more… graphics?"

The Outer Worlds 2 is deepening the role-playing mechanics of the first game by featuring over 90 unique perks for players to customize their character with.

In the end, The Outer Worlds 2 isn't trying to outmatch Starfield at its own game more than it is leveling the playing field a bit. Rather than going after scale for the sake of scale, The Outer Worlds 2 wants to offer something sharper, more deliberate, and more consistent. It builds upon its predecessor's strengths while directly addressing where Starfield may have overreached, all without losing sight of its own identity. If Starfield is about breadth, then The Outer Worlds 2 looks like it's aiming for more depth — still expansive, but intentionally curated.

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games Where You Play As An Animal
item.description:
Summary

  • Play as diverse animals in open-world games for unique gaming experiences.
  • Games like WolfQuest offer realistic insights into animal behavior and life.
  • Experience chaos and mayhem as a shark in Maneater or as a mischievous goose in Untitled Goose Game .

Open-world games are among the most fun to explore in video gaming, allowing players to experience a different time, culture, or even a complete fantasy universe. Some games allow players to take control of an animal, giving them a wholly unique perspective, unlike the majority that feature humanoid protagonists.

Freely exploring the wild or even a more developed environment as an animal can be incredibly liberating, gaining an insight into life as a completely different creature. Here are some of the best open-world games where you play as an animal, ranked based on a combination of the game’s overall quality and popularity.

1 Maneater

Humanity And Sea Creatures Being Terrorized By A Shark

Your comment has not been saved

Maneater
5 /10
8.0 /10
Released
May 22, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Tripwire Interactive
Publisher(s)
Tripwire Interactive, Deep Silver
Platform(s)
Xbox One, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

For those who wish to dish out some punishment to humans for their many transgressions, Maneater is the perfect game. Playing as a young bull shark, the goal is to survive in the dangerous waters around Port Clovis and ultimately seek revenge on Scaly Pete, the hunter responsible for disfiguring her and killing her family.

Presented as a game show and featuring hilarious narration by Chris Parnell, there’s plenty to do in Maneater , as players grow their mutant shark into a gigantic apex predator. Some side quests and the constant need to feast on prey can feel somewhat repetitive, but overall, it is fun to wreak havoc along the coastline and battle other large oceanic monsters in the sea.

2 BioMutant

A Mammalian Creature Decides The Fate Of The Tree Of Life

Your comment has not been saved

BioMutant
5 /10
4.0 /10
Released
May 25, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Experiment 101
Publisher(s)
THQ Nordic
Platform(s)
PS4, PC, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Character creation has a huge impact on gameplay in BioMutant . Taking control of a small mammal, players determine its stats based on physical attributes during the creation process, such as a larger head, meaning that the creature has greater intellect, or a heavier build that makes it slower and capable of causing more damage.

The world is an interesting mixture of overgrown nature and steampunk, featuring branching storylines and several tribes that the player can ally with or destroy in battle. Some critics found the approach to puzzles and general goals to be repetitive, but BioMutant ’s unique premise, charming art design, and uncommon approach to its 'gun fu' combat has caused many to declare that the game is an underrated gem.

3 Goat Simulator 3

Wreak Havoc As A Goat

Your comment has not been saved

Goat Simulator 3
7 /10
8.5 /10
Released
November 17, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Coffee Stain North
Publisher(s)
Coffee Stain Publishing
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

By now, most players are probably aware of the over-the-top game where goats cause absolute mayhem, and Goat Simulator 3 is even more chaotic than its predecessor. Skipping over the second numbered entry in the series, the development team of Goat Simulator 3 claims that the map is 18 times larger than in the first game, and up to four players can join in the zany fun.

There is a story mode involving rising through the ranks of the Illuminati, but the main attraction of this game is to lick and headbutt pretty much everything in sight. There are also seven minigames for those engaging in multiplayer — and a customizable Goat Castle. Sadly, for goat enthusiasts, it’s not a completely realistic simulation of life as the horned farmyard animal, but it makes for an insanely fun time.

4 Cattails: Wildwood Story

Cozy Life Simulation With Cats

Your comment has not been saved

Cattails: Wildwood Story
Indie
Simulation
RPG
Adventure
Systems
9.0 /10
Released
March 2, 2023
ESRB
E For Everyone: Fantasy Violence

Platform(s)
PC, macOS, Nintendo Switch
Powered by

Often compared favorably with Stardew Valley , Cattails: Wildwood Story puts players in the furry paws of a fully customizable cat, as they build and lead a colony. There are plenty of different biomes in the enigmatic Wildwood, from swamps and forests to beaches and volcanoes.

Other cats can be enticed to join the colony and help build the town, and there are plenty of different herbs to cultivate and prey to hunt. Even romance is a possibility, forming a bond with a fellow feline to produce baby kittens. Not all is completely wholesome, however, as there are mysterious enemies that must be repelled, so keeping the colony safe is imperative.

5 WolfQuest: Anniversary Edition

Accurate Depiction Of Life In A Wolfpack

WolfQuest: Anniversary Edition
Life Simulation
Survival
Open-World
Systems
Developer(s)
eduweb

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Publisher(s)
eduweb
Early Access Release
July 25, 2019
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Praised by many for its accuracy, Wolfquest: Anniversary Edition is not only a fun simulation of the wolf lifestyle but also educational. Taking place in Yellowstone National Park on a stretch of wilderness almost fifty square kilometers in size, players can hunt, tackle other predators head on, and even tussle with rival packs of wolves over valuable territory or other commodities.

Sniffing is a key mechanic, as are interactions with other wolves, including a family-friendly courtship so that offspring may be produced to carry on the lineage, and the game, beyond the death of the player character. Multiplayer options are available too, for those who want to experience life as a wolf with their friends.

6 Little Kitty, Big City

A Small Cat Trying To Find Its Way Home... Eventually

Your comment has not been saved

Little Kitty, Big City
7.0 /10
Released
May 9, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Double Dagger Studio
Publisher(s)
Double Dagger Studio
Platform(s)
PC, Nintendo Switch, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Sometimes, large urban settings can be daunting, but that is not the case in Little Kitty, Big City . The titular little kitty is a domesticated cat trying to find its way home after getting lost in a Japanese city. The journey is as much of a joy as the end goal of reaching the owner’s apartment, with the metropolis acting as a playground for all kinds of action.

Seeing the human-made environment from a cat’s perspective is fascinating, and players have the choice of causing a ruckus if they wish. There are plenty of fellow animals to befriend and different fish to eat, which can help the player-character climb to higher locations and is required if they wish to make it all the way home.

7 A Short Hike

Climbing A Mountain And Enjoying The Journey

Your comment has not been saved

A Short Hike
7.0 /10
Released
April 5, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Adam Robinson-Yu
Publisher(s)
Adam Robinson-Yu
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Switch, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

A game that can be completed in just a few hours, A Short Hike stars an anthropomorphized bird called Claire as she aims to reach the top of Hawk Peak. Seven golden feathers must be collected to gain the ability to run, climb, swim, and glide to the summit, though there are twenty scattered around the island for those who wish to find them all.

Apart from climbing the mountain, players can converse with other hikers, even assist some of them, who will return the favor. There are also tons of activities and minigames, such as fishing and beachstickball, which is similar to volleyball. It may be a short game, but exploring the charming island is certainly a memorable and wholesome experience.

8 Untitled Goose Game

Be A Troublesome Goose

Your comment has not been saved

Untitled Goose Game
7.0 /10
Released
September 20, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
House House
Publisher(s)
Panic
Platform(s)
PS4, Switch, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Taking place in a peaceful English village, Untitled Goose Game presents the opportunity to turn this quiet rural spot upside down. Taking on the role of a pesky goose (or two of the feathered devils if a friend joins in local co-op), there are plenty of treasures to steal, people to torment, and messes to be made in just a few hours.

Some may doubt the open-world credentials of Untitled Goose Game , and while the full map is not available immediately, completing just a few tasks in each area gradually unlocks the map until it is a fully explorable sandbox environment with many shortcuts and secrets. The dedicated honk button is worth the price of admission alone, adding to the overall charm and to the irritation of the local residents, whose days are inevitably ruined when the belligerent poultry comes crashing through.

item.title: How to Get the Knights of the Nine Crusader Armor in Oblivion Remastered
item.description:
After you complete the "Pilgrimage" quest in Oblivion Remastered, you'll begin a series of quests to collect the Crusader's Relics and create the Knights of the Nine armor . As part of the Knights of the Nine DLC, this armor set can be collected as soon as you wish, though there are different schools of thought on when the best time to do so is. However, this guide is primarily concerned with showing you how to get the Crusader's Relics in Oblivion Remastered, and complete the Knights of the Nine DLC.

Helm of the Crusader Location – Oblivion Remastered

Shrine of the Crusader Quest Walkthrough:

The Helm of the Crusader is the first Crusader's Relic that you can find, and can be acquired through the " Shrine of the Crusader " quest. This quest tasks the player with entering the Vanua underwater ruin and locating a former Knight of the Nine named Sir Amiel. This fallen knight died trying to complete the same task that you have been asked to fulfill.

The entrance to Vanua is found on the floor of Lake Rumare , on the northeast side of the bridge that separates the lake from The Upper NIben river. This bridge is found in the southeast corner of the lake. The quest marker will give you the exact location of the Door to Vanua .

Vanua is only the first section of this ruin. As you make your way along the main path, you'll reach the small wooden door to the Shrine of the Crusader.

Make sure to take Sir Amiel's Ring from his body, as it plays an important role in " Priory of the Nine ." If you forget the ring, you'll have to come all the way back to the Shrine of the Crusader to get it.

Shortly after entering the Shrine of the Crusader, you'll drop into a large chamber with a square platform that is lined with ancient pillars. In the center of the platform you'll find the skeletal remains of SIr Amiel. Look at his arm, and you'll see the Knights of the Nine Shield , which is available to loot. This is not, however, the Shield of the Crusader , which is found later. Searching Sir Amiel will unlock the next quest, which is called " Priory of the Nine." However, "Shrine of the Crusader" will not be finished. You'll complete it when you locate the Crusader's Helm further on in the final section of the Shrine of the Crusader.

Absolutely do not forget to take Sir Amiel's Ring when you search his body.

The Lost Catacombs:

After encountering the body of Sir Amiel in the Shrine of the Crusader, use his key to open the western gate. Follow the main path until you reach the door to the third section of the ruins, The Lost Catacombs . You'll face many skeleton enemies in this short stretch of ruin, so be careful as you proceed.

You'll encounter two separate doors that lead you back to the Shrine of the Crusader while in the Lost Catacombs. The easy way to know which door you should use is to check the compass. The red quest marker on the compass will tell you when you are going through the right door, as it will show very few steps.

After going through the door, you'll come to a literal shrine, with the Helm of the Crusader on a small table above the brazier with blue flames. Take the helm, then jump to the lower level to exit the shrine, and move on to "Priory of the Nine".

Cuirass of the Crusader Location – Oblivion Remastered

Priory of the Nine Quest Walkthrough:

The second Crusader's Relic that you can acquire is the Cuirass of the Crusader, the centerpiece of the set. To collect this item, you'll need to visit the Priory of the Nine, which sits east of Skingrad, along the southern border in the West Weald .

Enter the priory's front door, then as soon as you are inside, turn left, and then left again. You should see a large Knights of the Nine symbol on the ground in front of the windows. Approach the symbol, and select Activate when prompted. The symbol will turn into a flight of stairs leading down to a secret chamber beneath the priory.

In the lower chamber, look for the door near the training dummy. This is the Door to Priory Undercroft . Open this door, and you'll find yourself in the Knights of the Nine's secret meeting chamber. You'll see the Cuirass of the Crusader on the wall ahead of you, but it will suddenly be blocked by some sort of magical barrier.

Suddenly, the ghosts of all former Knights of the Nine will form a circle in the chamber. Speak to the ghost of Sir Amiel, and he'll inform you that you must face each of the Knights in single combat to prove you are worthy of the Crusader's Relic. Once you defeat each member, the Cuirass of the Crusader will become available for you to collect.

After you collect the cuirass, speak to each of the ghosts. You'll unlock the clues to find the Shield of the Crusader, Boots of the Crusader, Mace of Zenithar, and Gauntlets of the Crusader. Each item will feature its own quest that you can activate. Once you complete the first set of quests, you'll receive the final quest that leads you to the Greaves of the Crusader and the Sword of the Crusader.

  • "Nature's Fury" – Boots of the Crusader
  • "Stendarr's Mercy" – Gauntlets of the Crusader
  • "The Path of the Righteous" – Mace of the Crusader
  • "Wisdom of the Ages" – Shield of the Crusader
  • Return to the Priory of the Nine
  • "The Faithful Squire" – Greaves & Sword of the Crusader

Boots & Gauntlets of the Crusader Location – Oblivion Remastered

Nature's Fury Quest Walkthrough – Boots of the Crusader:

" Nature's Fury " takes you to the Altar of Kynareth , which is just west of the Imperial City. If you haven't visited the area yet, you can fast-travel to the Chestnut Handy Stables on the western side of the city, then head directly west to the quest marker.

When you arrive at the marker, you'll see several attendants at the sight of worship. Speak to Avita Vesnia , who'll explain that you must complete a test from Kynareth. She does not tell you much about this test, other than the fact that you should remember to 'fear and respect' nature. She tells you to walk west into the Great Forest.

When you reach the next quest marker, you'll find a small clearing surrounded by large stones. You'll receive a quest update that tells you to wait and see what Kynareth has in store. Shortly after the update, a Forest Guardian will approach you in the form of a bear. Do not attack the bear . You can try to avoid being attacked, but do not do anything that could be seen as returning hostilities.

If you avoid fighting back, Kynareth will be pleased, opening a door in one of the large rocks that reveals the entrance to a cave. Inside the cave, you'll find the Boots of the Crusader.

Stendarr's Mercy – Gauntlets of the Crusader:

To collect the Gauntlets of the Crusader , you'll need to head to the Chapel of Stendarr in Chorrol . The quest is relatively quick, but it requires taking on the curse of an unfortunate young man named Kellen .

Inside the Chapel of Stendarr, you'll see the Gauntlets of the Crusader on the ground behind the main shrine. Unfortunately, they have been affected by a curse, which renders them too heavy to pick up. Speak to Areldur, the priest in charge of the chapel. He'll tell you of Kellen, the descendant of the Knight who was wearing the gauntlets when he was cursed. The curse has spread through generations, and now affects him.

After speaking with Kellen, return to confront Areldur. He'll admit that he knows of a way to cure Kellen, but cannot bring himself to do it. He explains that the curse can only be removed from Kellen if someone else takes it on. He will explain how the process works. You must pray at the altar, asking Stendarr for the power to remove the curse from Kellen.

After praying at the altar, Stendarr will imbue you with the Lay Hands spell. The curse appears to affect your Fatigue level somehow, but for now, return to Kellen and cast the Lay Hands spell on him. He will be cursed, you will be cursed, but you can now collect the Gauntlets of the Crusader.

Mace of the Crusader Location – Oblivion Remastered

The Path of the Righteous Quest:

You must collect and equip the Boots of the Crusader before collecting the Mace of the Crusader.

The Mace of Zenithar , also called the Mace of the Crusader , is likely the easiest Crusader's Relic to collect. Once you have the Boots of the Crusader, head to the Great Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin .

Once you enter the chapel, a guard named Carodus Oholin will automatically engage with you. Speak with him to learn about the mace, then make your way downstairs to the Chapel Undercroft.

In the Undercroft, walk to the back of the chamber and interact with the Tomb of Saint Kaladas. This will transport you to another realm, where the Mace of the Crusader can be seen on an isolated pillar in the center of a dark void.

There is a path of light that leads out to the mace. With the Boots of the Crusader equipped, simply walk out to the Mace of the Crusader and collect it.

Shield of the Crusader Location – Oblivion Remastered

Wisdom of the Ages:

" Wisdom of the Ages " takes you to Fort Bulwark, which is not far northeast of Leyawiin. This fort is overrun with Conjurers, so make sure you are prepared for a real fight.

This is a massive dungeon, though it is not particularly difficult to navigate. There are three key points where you need to take specific actions, so, instead of focusing on every twist and turn of Fort Bulwark, we'll show you how to complete these specific puzzles. For the majority of the fort, you can simply follow the quest marker in the compass.

The first location is not a puzzle specifically, but a lever that is easy to miss, and can stop your progress dead if you don't locate it. At the end of the first major area, you'll encounter the chamber with the first Conjurer Adept, who is accompanied by another regular Conjurer. After you defeat them, turn the lever that is against the wall within the same chamber.

Then, as you leave the chamber, make a left when you come to the split. Follow that path all the way to its end, and you'll encounter another lever that must be activated. This will lower a drawbridge below, which you can see from the lever.

The next location is the first major puzzle room. This one is pretty simple if you speak to the prisoner. Turn all the statues so they are facing the circle in the center. This will reveal the exit that allows you to continue to the final area.

The third chamber is the final puzzle. In this chamber, you'll find a wall lined with small chests, and a large chest in the center of the chamber. Normally, you have to pay attention to the item that is revealed when you step on the switch in front of the large chest, then slowly learn where each item is supposed. This took us forever to do organically, so I highly suggest using the system below.

If you are standing with your back to the large chest , looking at the exit, we're going to number the small chests left to right . There are eight chests, and eight items you must place. You pick one item from the large chest at a time. You'll know you've placed the right item when the statue above the chest turns around. The item order is as follows:

  • Chest 1: Rodgar's Stone
  • Chest 2: Rodgar's Helm
  • Chest 3: Rodgar's Goblet
  • Chest 4: Rodgar's Sword
  • Chest 5: Rodgar's Book
  • Chest 6: Rodgar's Hammer
  • Chest 7: Rodgar's Skull
  • Chest 8: Rodgar's Gem

Greaves & Sword of the Crusader Location – Oblivion Remastered

The Faithful Squire Quest – Greaves & Sword of the Crusader:

The final two Crusader's Relics come as a sort of package deal. When you return to the Priory of the Nine after collecting the previous six pieces, you'll immediately encounter Lathon, the squire of another knight who had gone in search of the relics. He tells you the tale of how his former master found the Greaves of the Crusader and Sword of the Crusader. As his master was dying, he used his last breath to ensure Lathon took the Greaves.

Lathon gives you the Greaves of the Crusader on the spot. He then tells you that the Sword of the Crusader has been cursed by the wraith that killed his master, and you must go to Underpall Cave to retrieve it.

Before leaving for Underpall Cave, make sure your armor is fully repaired, and any enchanted items you use are fully charged.

Underpall Cave is located along the Orange Road, northeast of Chorrol. If you agree to knight Lathon, he will accompany you on the quest to collect the sword.

Underpall Cave is a massive complex, and it can be fairly confusing. Luckily, there is a fairly straight method of reaching your destination. After you enter the cave, you'll make your way to the doors of Underpall Keep, a massive underground fort complex. The entire structure is overrun with Ghosts, Zombies, Skeletons, and Skeleton Guardians. That last enemy is a particularly tough foe, especially when they are in large numbers.

Once you enter Underpall Keep, make a left into the first large chamber, and then immediately turn left and enter the first corridor you see. This is how most players will get lost, is not realizing they are supposed to make this double left turn right after entering the keep.

After entering the corridor, it's essentially a straight line to the Underpall Reflecting Chamber . After going through the next door into the Reflecting Chamber, head to the end of the long tunnel and make a right. Wind your way through the narrow paths, and you'll quickly come to a massive chamber with a large lake. You'll see Lord Berich Vlindrel floating on the edge of the lake. This is the enemy who holds the Sword of the Crusader.

Vlindrel is a wraith, so he is not susceptible to regular melee damage. Using an enchanted weapon will work, or a spell. We were able to take him down surprisingly quickly using the simple Flames spell. Once he his killed, he will drop the sword. It is not found on his remains, you must pick up the sword where it dropped.

Once you have the sword, you must take it to be reconsecrated before you can use it. You must take it to the Grand Chapel of Arkay in Cheydinhal . When you arrive, the chapel will be under attack by several Aurorans . Defeat them, then use the large altar in the center of the chapel to reconsecrate the sword. This completes your list of Crusader's Relics.

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion™ Remastered modernizes the 2006 Game of the Year with all new stunning visuals and refined gameplay. Explore the vast landscape of Cyrodiil like never before and stop the forces of Oblivion from overtaking the land in one of the greatest RPGs ever from the award-winning Bethesda Game Studios.

Rediscover Cyrodiil
Journey through the rich world of Tamriel and battle across the planes of Oblivion where handcrafted details have been meticulously recreated to ensure each moment of exploration is awe-inspiring.

Navigate Your Own Story
From the noble warrior to the sinister assassin, wizened sorcerer, or scrappy blacksmith, forge your path and play the way you want.

Experience an Epic Adventure
Step inside a universe bursting with captivating stories and encounter an unforgettable cast of characters. Master swordcraft and wield powerful magic as you fight to save Tamriel from the Daedric invasion.

The Complete Story
Experience everything Oblivion has to offer with previously released story expansions Shivering Isles, Knights of the Nine, and additional downloadable content included in The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered.
